expression: too many cooks spoil the broth

selectionMeta.selectedPhrase: too many cooks spoil the broth

step1.sentence: The product launch kept getting delayed because too many cooks spoil the broth — every department wanted final say on the design.

step2.story: The committee had twelve members, each insisting on changes to the annual report. Deadlines slipped as every revision triggered a new round of objections. It was a textbook case of too many cooks spoil the broth.

step3.story: Maya had been excited when the startup hired three additional creative directors to help with the rebrand. At first the ideas flowed freely, but soon every concept was pulled in a dozen directions. One director wanted bold colors; another insisted on minimalism; a third kept reopening decisions everyone thought were final. Weeks passed without a single approved logo. The CEO finally pulled Maya aside and said, 'We've learned the hard way that too many cooks spoil the broth — pick one lead and let them run with it.' Maya nodded, relieved someone had finally said it out loud.

meaning.realUsageKo: 어떤 일에 관여하는 사람이 너무 많으면 서로 의견이 충돌해 오히려 일을 망칠 수 있다는 뜻으로 사용된다. 주로 의사결정이 지연되거나 결과물의 질이 떨어지는 상황을 비판할 때 쓴다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 16세기 영국 속담에서 유래했으며, 실제 요리 현장에서 여러 사람이 간을 맞추다 보면 맛이 엉망이 된다는 경험에서 비롯된 표현이다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 비판적이지만 유머러스한 어조로 쓰이는 경우가 많다. 직접적인 비난보다는 상황을 가볍게 꼬집는 뉘앙스가 있어, 회의나 팀 프로젝트 맥락에서 부드럽게 문제를 지적할 때 적합하다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: We should assign one person to make the final call — too many cooks spoil the broth.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 최종 결정권자를 한 명 정해야 해 — 사공이 많으면 배가 산으로 가거든.
